path.description: The path fork-version will run from. Defaults to "process.cwd()".

changelog.description: Name of the changelog file. Defaults to "CHANGELOG.md".

header.description: The header to be used in the changelog.

files.description: List of the files to be updated.

glob.description: Glob pattern to match files to be updated.

tagPrefix.description: Specify a prefix for the tag fork-version will create. Defaults to "v".

preReleaseTag.description: Make a pre-release with an optional label.

commitAll.description: If true, we'll commit all changes, not just files updated by fork-version.

debug.description: If true, we'll log debug information.

dryRun.description: If true, no output will be written to disk or committed.

gitTagFallback.description: Fallback and attempt to use the latest git tag as the current version. Defaults to true.

inspectVersion.description: If true, we'll log the current version and exit.

sign.description: If true, we'll sign the git commit using GPG.

silent.description: If true, no output will be written to stdout.

verify.description: If true, run git commit hooks.

currentVersion.description: If set, we'll use this as the current version

nextVersion.description: If set, we'll use this as the next version.

type.description: The type of commit message, such as "feat", "fix", "chore".

section.description: The section of the `CHANGELOG` the commit should show up in.

hidden.description: Should show in the generated changelog message?

types.description: List of explicitly supported commit message types.

commitUrlFormat.description: A URL representing a specific commit at a hash.

compareUrlFormat.description: A URL representing the comparison between two git SHAs.

issueUrlFormat.description: A URL representing the issue format.

userUrlFormat.description: A URL representing a user's profile on GitHub, Gitlab, etc.

releaseCommitMessageFormat.description: A string to be used to format the auto-generated release commit message.

issuePrefixes.description: List of prefixes used to detect references to issues.
